entry.title: we're all reaching out to find another hand
entry.summary:
Author: soter

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,258Chapters: 1/18Kudos: 11

Summary: “I know you’re a meta,” you blurt. Jason stares. “What.” “I saw your hand—I saw the cut and the blood, but then, it was healed, somehow, right, and like, I know I wasn’t supposed to see that and then I felt really bad about it and I wanted to let you know that I know but I didn’t want you to think I was going to, like, blackmail you—” “Blackmail me?” “Of course not,” you quickly say. “Never. No. That’s horrible. Can you imagine what would happen if it got out?” You wince. “Sorry, stupid question, you probably have.”or in which you discover that your neighbor, Jason Todd, is a metahuman, try to compensate, and things get a little... weird.

Summary: Jason finally finally comes face to face with his soulmate. But there is only one problem; she doesn't know him anymore. This confuses Jason because they've known each other every since they were children. He needs to know what happened, even if it means having to ask Dick Grayson. entry.title: The Blind Date
entry.summary:
Author: Ava_Mae

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,029Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 35

Summary: You turned in a circle, looking around the entire coffee shop for any sign of Scott, completely confused on where he had gone. Had he gone to the bathroom while you were up? Or had he… just up and left? Surely he hadn't done that. You let out a sigh. Okay. Whatever. So it was a busted date, then. You glanced back at the table again to make sure you weren't forgetting anything, and paused when you noticed a note scrawled on a napkin. He was a bad date. Try again.       Better luck next time.You stared at the note blankly. The first part of the message was in a spiky handwriting, while the second part was in an elegant cursive. Two different people had written this note. But why? Why did they care about your failed attempt at dating? "Whatever. Fuck this," you muttered to yourself. You'd just have to learn to deal with your unrequited crush and permanent singleness. Fine.

entry.title: Strawberry Waffles
entry.summary:
Author: lushescape

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,900Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 157

Summary: “Like a date?” You ask in a near whisper. Jason looks like he's been electrocuted but slowly he nods his head twice. “Yeah. A date. You and me, the school dance.” Oh. Your heart feels like it's beating so fast it's going to stop at any second. But you nod, your face warm, and there's no way you can stop yourself from smiling now. “Um, y- yeah.” You stammer before clearing your throat softly. “Yes.” You say, more confident in your answer. “Yes, I would.. love to go with you. On a date. To the dance.” Or Jason Todd becomes a girl dad after dying and coming back to life

entry.title: Strangers in the Night
entry.summary:
Author: unnamedmystery

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 31,002Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 145

Summary: When the Daily Planet heard word of a new vigilante in Crime Alley that supposedly had no affiliation with Batman, Perry White thought it to be a nice short story—a quick in and out. After all, while the people of Metropolis had Superman, everyone knew of Batman, and a vigilante not working with him seemed interesting. At least, that’s what Perry told his college intern. And her mentor Clark Kent when he raised concerns. No one told her that the vigilante was intimidatingly attractive. Or that Crime Alley was the worse place in Gotham City. Or that her mentor would ask a friend to keep tabs on her. Or that the detective she’s staying with hates Batman despite working with him frequently. Or that the detectives neighbor was a really cute guy.
